item.title: The Home of the Blessed
item.description: Why do some families thrive while others collapse under stress? In this message, we unpack Jesus’ ‘house on the rock’ blueprint (Matthew 7), trace biblical promises for humble households, and hear Mendelssohn’s organ lesson on letting the Master take the keys. Expect real-life stories, archaeological snapshots from Capernaum, and four faith-builders that help your home stand firm through rain, floods, winds, and relentless pounding. Perfect for couples, parents, and anyone longing for a steadfast, grace-filled household.

item.title: Love in Action
item.description: Generosity isn’t an optional upgrade for disciples—Jesus says it’s the family trait (John 13:35). In this message we unpack Deuteronomy 15, Galatians 6, and 1 John 3 to show why real faith opens its hand to every neighbor. You’ll learn how to spot true “needs,” guard your heart from stinginess, and keep giving even when the needs never end. Stay to the end for a practical challenge that will stretch your faith and soften your heart. Speaker: Gionte Solomon

item.title: Heart Check
item.description: How do loss-of-control fears, pride, and buried grudges block the love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control God longs to grow in us? Drawing on Galatians 5, Matthew 5 & 18, Philippians 3, and Colossians 3, this lesson walks through practical steps for humble submission to Christ, courageous conflict resolution, and Spirit-filled unity within the church family. Speaker: Robert Clouse

item.title: Family Curses
item.description: Generational patterns don’t have the final word. In this message we trace “family curses” from Eli’s priests to Saul’s dynasty and all the way back to Adam—then watch Jesus cancel every debt at the cross. You’ll see why Exodus 20 and Ezekiel 18 actually agree, how trauma and choice intertwine, and seven practical steps to end destructive cycles. If you’re ready to replace inherited pain with promised blessing, grab a Bible, open your notes app, and join us. Like, subscribe, and share with someone rewriting their family legacy today.

item.title: Holy Ambition
item.description: From spiritual death to a life overflowing with purpose, Ephesians 2:1–10 charts the breathtaking rescue story of every believer. This sermon walks through four pivotal moments: our revival from ruin, elevation by mercy, redemption through grace, and restoration for a life that matters. Far from a surface-level message, it presses into the tension between our past rebellion and God's relentless kindness, calling every hearer to personal commitment and courageous faith. For anyone feeling stuck, unworthy, or unsure of their purpose—this is the wake-up call your soul’s been waiting for. Lesson by: Chaz Austin

item.title: The Mask of Righteousness
item.description: Are you wearing a spiritual mask? In this eye-opening message from Matthew 23:1–12, we peel back five deceptive layers that Jesus exposed in the religious leaders of His day. With a bold call to authenticity, humility, and true discipleship, this sermon challenges us to examine the Pharisee within and walk more closely with Christ, our only true Teacher. Lesson by: Chaz Austin

item.title: Creating Relationships for Soul Searching
item.description: How can sincere prayer shape your story, your ministry, and your mission? Walk through Matthew 6 and the Book of Acts to see how deep, honest relationships and bold evangelism begin with sincere prayer. With testimonies of faith, powerful historical stories, and a 3-step testimony model based on 1 Peter 3:15, this message will inspire you to reach the masses, the multitudes, and the menages—your household, your community, and beyond. Whether you're a seasoned believer or soul-searching, this message calls you to pray, share, and serve like never before.

item.title: A Thriving, Spiritual Marriage?
item.description: Ben Blackman delivers a passionate sermon exploring the sacred parallels between earthly marriage and our spiritual union with Christ. Rooted in Ephesians 5:22–33, the sermon challenges Christians to reflect on their marital commitments, their role as the bride of Christ, and the danger of spiritual complacency. With vivid biblical imagery, personal honesty, and calls to repentance, Brother Blackman exposes the modern church’s struggles with idolatry, neglect, and shallow devotion, offering instead the hopeful reminder of God’s unwavering faithfulness and redeeming love.

item.title: A Fisher of Men like Jonah
item.description: What does it take to become a true fisher of men? Journey through the unforgettable 21-step transformation of Jonah, the prophet who ran from God's call—only to be swallowed by grace. From a ship in the storm to the heart of Nineveh, discover how Jonah’s reluctant obedience mirrors the death, burial, and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Filled with humor, historical insight, and soul-searching reflection, this sermon invites you to recognize the storm, remember the fish, and respond to God's mercy. Be challenged. Be changed. Be caught by God.

item.title: Are you Happy?
item.description: Are you chasing happiness or building a life of lasting joy? In this special graduation Sunday sermon, we celebrate our seniors with a message straight from Matthew 6 on finding true, sustainable joy through worship, service, and surrender to Jesus. From sprinklers and youth camp pranks to heartfelt prayers and fasting, this lesson connects real-life stories with deep scriptural truths. Learn how to store up treasures in heaven, seek God in secret, and live a life that outlasts the moment. A must-hear for every believer stepping into a new season.

item.title: Press On, Graduates!
item.description: Graduates, life is coming at you fast—but Paul has something timeless to say about joy, purpose, and perseverance. In this uplifting reading and reflection on the entire book of Philippians, we unpack themes of thanksgiving, humility, spiritual maturity, and the ultimate prize: knowing Christ. Whether you're stepping into college, a career, or the unknown, this message reminds you that your true citizenship is in heaven and your strength is in Christ. Let this be your launchpad into a life of deeper faith, rooted joy, and unshakable hope. Speaker: Keegan Wilson

item.title: Pray Daily For Them
item.description: Explore how parents can raise godly children in an ungodly world by covering them in consistent, heartfelt prayer. Using Jesus’ own words in the Sermon on the Mount, this message outlines three transformative ways to pray for your kids: with persistence, sincerity, and a spirit of love—even when parenting feels hardest. Packed with Scripture (Matthew 7, 6, and 5), heartfelt song lyrics, and real-life applications, this lesson reminds every mom, dad, and grandparent that prayer is both a shield and a sword in the spiritual formation of our children. Whether you’re just starting your parenting journey or watching your grown kids raise their own, this sermon will reignite your purpose and passion.

item.title: The Second Mile Brings a Smile
item.description: What does it really mean to go the second mile? Explore Jesus’ radical teaching in Matthew 5:41 through relatable stories, ancient Roman history, and an unforgettable comparison between two men—Simon and Benjamin. From the daily grind of life's responsibilities to the eternal wisdom of Christ’s words, this message reminds us that true Christian living begins where obligation ends. The second mile brings a smile and then some. Speaker: Jim Adair

item.title: Kingdom on Trial
item.description: Step inside the final trial of Jesus Christ and witness the clash of four kingdoms: the crowds seeking cultural survival, the rulers clinging to their rank, Pilate preserving his fragile profession, and the Lamb revealing the only unshakable Kingdom. This message challenges every heart to choose between earthly fears and eternal truth. Explore the courage of Christ, the tragedy of worldly compromise, and the hope of a Kingdom not built by human hands.

item.title: Hope that Surpasses all Understanding
item.description: In a world weighed down by tragedy, personal pain, and uncertainty, how do we find the strength to keep going? This powerful sermon takes us from historical heartbreak to personal loss, from the storms of life to the still waters of faith. We explore events like the Oklahoma City bombing, Columbine, and the Boston Marathon attack—not to recount horror, but to illuminate the deeper question: Where is our hope when the world breaks? Anchored in the resurrection of Jesus Christ, this message draws from Peter's stormy walk (Matthew 14), Thomas’s doubt (John 20), and the empty tomb (Matthew 28), reminding us that faith isn't about seeing—it's about focusing on the One who saves when we sink. Through raw storytelling, biblical truth, and emotional testimony, this sermon offers a heartfelt call to find your 903 moment—when healing begins. If you’ve ever felt like Peter drowning in fear or Thomas drowning in doubt, this is a message for you. Speaker: Brandon Henson

item.title: Seven Witnesses of The Resurrection
item.description: Explore seven compelling witnesses to Jesus’ resurrection—Historians, the Gospels, the Tomb, the Apostles, His Brother, a Persecutor turned Preacher, and the explosive growth of the Church. Featuring real-life testimonies and ancient sources from Josephus, Tacitus, and Scripture, this sermon unveils undeniable evidence for the risen Christ. Stay to the end for a moving call to become the 8th Witness—your faith may change someone’s eternity.

item.title: How to Handle My Money #5
item.description: In this final message of our 5-part series on money management, we explore 7 life-changing principles drawn straight from Scripture—from viewing money vertically to enjoying it carefully. With insights from Proverbs, Jesus’ words in Matthew and Luke, and real-life examples like Tony Campolo’s radical generosity, this sermon challenges us to align our wallets with God’s will. Whether you're struggling financially or thriving, this message offers a perspective shift that leads to peace, purpose, and eternal investment. Learn how budgeting, giving, saving, and enjoying all fall under God’s design for your stewardship.

item.title: Keep the Main Thing the Main Thing
item.description: Terry challenges the Creekside congregation—and all of us—to “keep the main thing the main thing.” Dressed in a rare suit and tie (yes, it’s really him!), Terry opens up about his journey in missions, his role as a spiritual "lifeguard," and the urgent need for every Christian to find their wheelhouse in evangelism. Through personal stories, compelling scriptures (Matthew 28:18-20, Mark 16:15-16, 2 Corinthians 5:20, and more), and a vivid analogy of lifeguards watching over their grid. Whether you’re a teen, an elder, a new convert, or a seasoned believer, this sermon is a wake-up call and a call to action. Speaker: Terry Reeves

item.title: Pray Honestly
item.description: Why do we struggle with prayer when God already knows our hearts? In this vulnerable and story-rich message, we explore what it means to pray honestly—from the heartbreak of a newborn’s mysterious illness to the isolation of the ICU. Grounded in Matthew 6 and Philippians 4, this sermon reminds us that prayer isn’t about polished words—it’s about being known. Learn how God uses our wandering minds to reveal where our hearts truly are, and why personal, unfiltered prayer can transform our spiritual lives. Speaker: John Prpich

item.title: Husbands, Love Your Wives
item.description: What does it truly mean for husbands to love their wives as Christ loves the church? Explore God’s original design for marriage, the consequences of sin, and how Christ's sacrificial love restores harmony between husband and wife. Rooted in Ephesians 5, this sermon reveals the true beauty of biblical marriage — a union that mirrors Christ and His bride, the church. Learn how submission, sacrifice, and unity reflect God's redemptive plan for every couple seeking holiness in their home. Speaker: Mike Hagger

item.title: 5 Witnesses from God’s General Revelation
item.description: What if the people you meet already know more about God than they realize? This sermon reveals five undeniable witnesses to God's reality written into our world—from conscience to creation, from longing to the law of harvest. Learn how Acts 14:17 and Romans 1 equip you to reach hearts not by arguing, but by awakening truths already seen, heard, and felt. Perfect for soul-winners, evangelists, and anyone seeking to speak truth into a skeptical age. Speaker: Sean Andrews

item.title: How to Handle My Money #4
item.description: Handling money wisely isn’t just about saving and budgeting—it’s about giving with the right heart. In this powerful message, we explore three essential principles of biblical generosity: honoring the Lord, keeping our commitments, and caring for the poor. Through engaging stories, scripture, and practical insights, you’ll gain a fresh perspective on how to be a faithful steward of God’s blessings. Don’t miss this life-changing lesson!

item.title: The Bible is Full of Contradictions?
item.description: Are there real contradictions in the Bible—or just misunderstood contexts? In this thought-provoking sermon, Marvin Phillips addresses skeptics’ top claims, including God’s justice in war, the Bible's stance on slavery, differing Gospel timelines of Christ’s crucifixion, and supposed scientific errors in Scripture. Through in-depth scriptural comparisons and historical insight, this message challenges doubts and reinforces trust in God's word as consistent, just, and true. A must-watch for anyone wrestling with Bible difficulties or seeking a stronger foundation for faith in the 21st century. Speaker: Marvin Phillips

item.title: How to Handle My Money #3
item.description: Many struggle to find the right balance between saving, spending, and giving. Should Christians pursue wealth, or is it better to live with less? In this powerful lesson, we explore three key budgeting principles rooted in Scripture: Reserving money for purchases, Risking money for profits, and Reassuring money for protection. We’ll also examine the Jewish concept of Tikkun Olam (repairing the world) and how it relates to biblical financial wisdom. Whether you’re in debt or seeking to grow in stewardship, this lesson will equip you to be rich toward God while managing your finances wisely!

item.title: The Closer View of Jesus’ Apprentices
item.description: Are you truly ready to be an apprentice of Jesus? In this powerful sermon on Luke 6, we take a closer look at Jesus' apprentices—their faith, struggles, and calling. Learn how being with Jesus, like Jesus, and filled with Jesus defines true discipleship. With inspiring examples, biblical truths, and a call to radical surrender, this message challenges us to follow Christ wholeheartedly. Will you step into His calling?

item.title: How to Handle My Money #2
item.description: Struggling with finances? Learn how to handle money biblically in Part 2 of "God Is Able: How to Handle My Money!" Discover practical steps rooted in scripture to save wisely, pay off debt, and cut unnecessary spending with discernment, determination, and discipline. This message is packed with biblical wisdom and real-life insights to help you become a faithful steward of God’s blessings. Don't miss it!

item.title: Thankfulness in Our Spiritual Lives
item.description: Gratitude is more than just a command—it’s a heartfelt response to the immeasurable gift of salvation! 🙏 Join us as we explore the role of thankfulness in our spiritual lives, its impact on our growth, relationships, and daily walk with God. Drawing from 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18, Philippians 4:6, and Psalm 103, we’ll see how remembering, rehearsing, and reflecting on God’s blessings sustains our faith. Don’t take the greatest gift for granted—cultivate a thankful heart today! Lesson by Jack Birckholtz

item.title: God is Able: Over The Top
item.description: What happens when we give all we have to Jesus? In this powerful message, we explore the story of the feeding of the 5,000 (John 6:1-13) and how God multiplies our faith and generosity beyond what we can imagine. Learn how giving—whether time, talents, or resources—can be "over the top" when placed in the hands of Christ. Are you ready to trust God with your little and see Him do something big?
item.itunes:author: Creekside Church of Christ

item.title: Witchcraft
item.description: Many people dismiss witchcraft as mere fantasy, but what does the Bible say? In this sermon, we uncover five key evils of witchcraft—rebellion, seduction, execution, superstition, and treason—using scripture to reveal its true nature. Learn how biblical figures like Saul and Balaam fell into these practices and what God commands regarding this. Are demons simply wicked spirits of the dead, or is there more to their story? Watch now to uncover the biblical truth about witchcraft, spiritual warfare, and the power of God that overcomes all evil.

item.title: Stewardship Is Giving
item.description: Giving is more than an obligation—it’s a matter of the heart! This powerful sermon unpacks seven heart connections to biblical stewardship, showing how generosity transforms our lives and aligns us with God's purpose. Through Old and New Testament wisdom, humorous anecdotes, and moving real-life stories (including the powerful example of Oskar Schindler), you'll discover how a kind, cheerful, and grateful heart leads to abundant blessings. Are you giving with the right heart? Find out why true stewardship changes everything!

item.title: Stewardship Is Priorities
item.description: Are your priorities in order? Join us as we explore the biblical principles of stewardship and how putting God first in our giving, love, works, and service impacts every aspect of life. With compelling real-life examples, scriptural insights, and a challenge to reassess our focus, this message will inspire you to honor God with your time, talents, and treasures. Don't miss this life-changing lesson on what it truly means to be a faithful steward!

item.title: Stewardship Is Responsibility
item.description: What does it mean to be a responsible steward of God's blessings? This message unpacks Matthew 25:14-30, revealing how stewardship connects to assets, abilities, and accountability. Through relatable stories and practical insights, discover how faithful stewardship can lead to a life of abundance in Christ. Don't miss this empowering lesson on living responsibly for God's glory!

item.title: Stewardship Is Management
item.description: Stewardship is serious business. Explore the biblical principles of management as we delve into 1 Corinthians 4:1-2 and other scriptures. Learn how God entrusts us with time, talents, treasures, and more, calling us to manage them faithfully and reverently. This message reveals how stewardship reflects our relationship with God and highlights inspiring examples from scripture and history to encourage us to care for what matters most: people. Watch now to be equipped for a life of faithful stewardship that honors Him!

item.title: A Good Budget Report and Potentials
item.description: How can your church's financial stewardship reflect God’s provision and glorify His work? In this practical sermon, explore how a Good Budget Report is worshipful, cooperative, and comprehensive, with clear scriptural backing. Dive into real-world budgeting, motivational examples, and the spiritual potential of sacrificial giving. Perfect for church leaders, members, and anyone seeking to understand financial stewardship in a biblical light.

item.title: Stewardship of Priorities
item.description: Join Willy Smith as he explores the biblical principle of stewardship and its role in aligning our hearts and lives with God's will. Drawing from Matthew 6:19-34, the speaker challenges us to seek first the Kingdom of God, manage the blessings we've been entrusted with, and avoid the pitfalls of worldly-mindedness. Learn how to live a life that pleases God, prioritize eternal treasures, and embrace your responsibility as a faithful steward of God’s gifts.

item.title: How to Handle My Money
item.description: Learn how to handle your money God's way! This sermon explores three foundational steps—taking monetary inventory, tracking expenses, and budgeting monthly—all grounded in biblical wisdom. Packed with insights from Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and the teachings of Jesus, this message offers practical advice for financial stewardship and spiritual growth. Perfect for anyone seeking a balanced, faith-filled approach to money management and life.

item.title: The Effects
item.description: Explore how the devil uses deception through psychological traps like the Dunning-Kruger Effect, the Barnum Effect, and others to lead us astray from God's truth. Through scripture and thought-provoking examples, this message reveals the schemes of the enemy and equips you to stand firm in God's Word, finding freedom in the truth of Christ. Perfect for personal growth or group discussion.

item.title: New Year Renewed Mind
item.description: As the new year approaches, are your resolutions aligned with God's purpose for your life? This inspiring message dives into Romans 12:2 and other key scriptures, encouraging us to renew our minds, set heavenly goals, and submit to God's will. Learn practical steps for spiritual transformation, discover the joy of trusting in God’s plans, and find hope in the ultimate resolution—Jesus Christ. A must-watch for anyone seeking peace, purpose, and a fresh start in 2025.

item.title: Love Your Lord
item.description: Explore the depth of what it means to "Love Your Lord" as we unpack the greatest commandment through the words of Jesus. This heartfelt sermon examines how to love God with all your heart, soul, and mind, offering practical steps and biblical insights to transform your devotion. Featuring real-life examples, thought-provoking quotes, and scriptural clarity, this message challenges and inspires us to align our lives with God's ultimate call for love and faithfulness.

item.title: Prince of Peace
item.description: Explore the profound truths of Jesus Christ as the Prince of Peace, as we uncover how He brings peace with God, with others, and within ourselves. Featuring heartfelt stories, humor, and timeless Scriptures like Isaiah 9:6, this lesson offers both hope and practical ways to embrace Christ’s peace in your life. Find encouragement and strength in the gospel of His kingdom, the cross of Christ, and His guarding grace.

Featuring heartfelt stories and Scripture-rich insights, this message will inspire you to embrace Christ's eternal care.

item.title: Love Your Country
item.description: Explore the profound balance between patriotism and heavenly citizenship in this insightful message. This sermon examines how Christians can love their earthly country while staying focused on their eternal home in God’s kingdom. Rooted in Scripture, it challenges believers to prioritize righteousness, seek God’s will, and live as ambassadors of heaven. Perfect for those seeking to deepen their faith and understanding of spiritual priorities.

item.title: Love Your Work
item.description: Work can be challenging, but did you know it’s a gift from God? This engaging sermon explores six biblical reasons to love your work—covering everything from providing for your family to strengthening your faith. With relatable humor and deep scriptural insights, you'll gain a fresh perspective on labor and its divine purpose in your life. Learn to find joy, fulfillment, and meaning in your daily tasks. Perfect for workers, leaders, and anyone looking to connect their job to their faith journey!

item.title: Mighty God
item.description: Explore the powerful truth of Isaiah 9:6 as we call Jesus Christ our "Mighty God." This sermon highlights how Christ’s eternal promises, saving grace, and problem-solving power transform lives. Discover how His influence reaches into every storm, providing peace and salvation for all who trust Him. Perfect for those seeking hope, assurance, and the joy of Christmas rooted in His divine nature.

item.title: Wonderful Counselor
item.description: Explore how Jesus Christ embodies the title "Wonderful Counselor," offering guidance that is helpful, unchanging, and deeply healing for our brokenness. This lesson dives into Isaiah 9:6-7 and other profound scriptures to reveal how His counsel provides spiritual stability, confidence, and hope for all. Embrace the life-changing wisdom of the ultimate Counselor.

item.title: Love Your Church
item.description: How can you love your church like Christ loves His bride? In this heartfelt sermon, discover three transformative ways to embrace your church—through your pains, perils, and prayers. With deep scriptural insights from 2 Corinthians 11 and Ephesians 5, you’ll learn practical steps to strengthen your relationship with your congregation, overcome challenges, and rekindle your passion for God’s people. Perfect for anyone feeling disconnected, this message will inspire you to 'be the church' and find joy in serving. Watch now and grow in love for His church!

item.title: Missing Thanksgiving
item.description: Explore the timeless lessons from Luke 17:11-19 on gratitude and how to avoid "Missing Thanksgiving." Through inspiring personal stories, biblical truths, and heartfelt encouragement, this sermon reminds us to recognize blessings, return to the source, and rejoice with thanksgiving. A powerful message for deepening your faith and fostering gratitude in your daily walk with God.

item.title: Love Your Brethren
item.description: Brotherly love isn’t just an ideal—it’s a command! This heartfelt sermon examines how loving our brethren demonstrates righteousness, eternal life, and devotion to God (1 John 3:10-18). Featuring powerful historical examples, reflections on Jesus’ teachings, and a stirring challenge to live out genuine love, this message will inspire you to strengthen your bonds with those in Christ. Don't just listen—act with love, in deed and in truth!

item.title: The Cross of Jesus Christ
item.description: Explore the ABCs of Faith through the Cross of Jesus Christ. This study highlights humanity's fall into sin, God's plan for redemption through Christ's sacrifice, and the biblical preconditions for salvation. Discover the vital role of faith, repentance, confession, and baptism in entering into Christ and receiving His saving grace. With rich Scripture references and practical questions, this lesson invites you to reflect on your walk with Jesus. Perfect for personal reflection or group study.

item.title: Love Your Enemy
item.description: Learn from Jesus' radical approach to love as He cared for those who opposed Him, even extending grace to His betrayers. In this stirring sermon, explore why Jesus’ command to love our enemies is crucial for our relationships, our communities, and our world. With real-life stories, thought-provoking insights, and challenging calls to action, you'll be inspired to walk in His footsteps and cultivate a love that transforms enmity into unity.

item.title: Believers in Jesus Christ
item.description: Explore the essential principles that define a believer’s life and commitment to the Church in "ABCs of Faith: Believers in Jesus Christ." This powerful message unpacks foundational concepts such as unity, biblical organization, and heartfelt worship, reminding us of the single-minded dedication Jesus taught. Reflect on why worship, structure, and fellowship matter deeply in the life of every Christian. Let’s delve into how believers are called to be one body, embracing a faith that honors Christ and His Church.

item.title: Love Your Neighbor
item.description: Explore the transformative power of "Love Your Neighbor as Yourself," unpacking Jesus' timeless command with real-life examples, practical insights, and a moving historical story. Learn how small acts of kindness, respect, and understanding can reveal God's love in profound ways across all boundaries. Join us for this inspiring lesson on embodying Christ's love in daily life.

item.title: Authority of Jesus Christ
item.description: Explore the unparalleled authority of Jesus Christ in this in-depth 'ABCs of Faith' series. This lesson reveals how Jesus' teachings and the New Testament shape our faith and daily lives. Through powerful verses learn how Christ’s authority remains central to salvation, worship, and godly living. For seekers and believers alike, this message underscores the eternal significance of God's Word in the world today.

item.title: Halloween: The Spirit of Fear vs. The Spirit of Boldness
item.description: Explore the ultimate victory of the Spirit of Boldness over the Spirit of Fear, a message that reminds us of the power, love, and sound mind we receive through faith in Christ (2 Tim. 1:7). Drawing from scripture, this sermon delves into the boldness believers are called to, even in times that heighten our awareness of fear. Learn how prayer, righteousness, and hope empower us to live free from fear and instead with the courage to stand boldly in God's promises.

item.title: What We Need To Face Spiritual Battles
item.description: Facing spiritual battles requires more than just effort—it calls for perspective, preparation, and perseverance. In this message, we explore Ephesians 6:10-20 and other key Scriptures to understand the armor of God and how to stand firm in faith. Through biblical insights, historical stories, and practical applications, we learn what it takes to resist the devil and grow stronger in the Lord.

item.title: The Soul's Community
item.description: In this heartfelt message, explore how your attendance at church services impacts the entire community of believers. Learn from the examples of biblical figures like Paul, Abraham, and Christ Himself, who faithfully modeled dedication to God's people. This sermon challenges you to follow in their footsteps, showing up for your faith and your fellow Christians in these difficult times. Be a light, an example, and a part of building up the body of Christ today.

item.title: Enduring the Storm (After Hurricane Milton)
item.description: How do we navigate life’s storms—whether physical, emotional, or spiritual? In this heartfelt sermon, we reflect on recent challenges, from hurricanes to personal trials, and explore how figures like Noah, Jonah, Job, and the disciples weathered their storms with faith, repentance, and humility. Discover the steadfast love of God and His call for us to trust, repent, and focus on His purpose amidst chaos. Uplifting stories of community resilience and God's provision will inspire you to see His hand in every storm. Will you turn to Him today?

item.title: Unexpected Results of United Continuous Prayer
item.description: In the wake of Hurricane Milton, we’ve seen firsthand the power of united continuous prayer. From Acts 12, we’ll uncover how prayer brought an unexpected shift in our storms, stirred service within our community, and even led to salvation in the most surprising ways. This timely message reveals how prayer can break chains, open doors, and spark hope in the aftermath of disaster. Join us for an inspiring look at what happens when we pray together in faith!

item.title: The Soul’s Comestibles
item.description: Explore how church services act as "The Soul's Comestibles," providing spiritual nourishment through teaching, fellowship, communion, and prayer. This sermon dives into why many have strayed from regular attendance and offers biblical reasons to remain devoted to attending all services. Learn how personal tastes, both physical and spiritual, can be shaped and transformed by God's word. "Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good!" (Psalm 34:8). Find encouragement to feed your soul and renew your commitment today!

item.title: Seven Divorces of Christ and His Church
item.description: What are the "Seven Divorces" between Christ and His Church? In this sermon, we explore the spiritual consequences when believers abandon their relationship with Christ for worldly reasons—whether it be for inheritance, freedom, betrayal, or unbelief. Rooted in Scripture, this message challenges us to stay faithful to our spiritual commitments, even when the temptations of this world pull us away. How can we resist self-justification and remain true to the church?

item.title: The Soul's Customs
item.description: This message dives deep into the customs of Jesus and how regular worship transforms our spiritual lives. Learn how attending every service helps build faith, control thoughts, and praise God. Discover the seven reasons strong Christians make it a habit, and hear powerful testimonies of devotion that will challenge and inspire you. Would others know you're on the Lord's side? Let this sermon ignite your passion for worship!

item.title: The Soul’s Commitment
item.description: Why does evening worship matter? Explore the biblical foundations, historical traditions, and spiritual benefits of attending both morning and evening services. Learn how consistent worship brings us closer to God, and how our soul's commitment should reflect God's place in our lives. Featuring insights from early Christian practices and key scriptural examples.

item.title: Ten Kinds of Love
item.description: Explore the ten profound types of love described in the Bible—from unconditional to unrequited love—through touching stories, scriptures, and timeless reflections. Gain new insights on how we are called to love others and experience God's unending love for us. Be inspired to deepen your understanding of love in action!

item.title: Mercy Principles
item.description: Explore Gospel principles for parenting centered on God's profound mercy. Learn how God's mercy—higher than the heavens and wider than the east from the west—can transform your approach to parenting. Featuring scripture-based insights, practical applications, and real-life stories of forgiveness, this sermon encourages parents to show mercy to their children as God does to us.

item.title: The Soul's Cost
item.description: What does it truly cost to be a disciple of Christ? This sermon delves into the spiritual significance of attending church services, examining the soul's challenge of consistently hearing, worshiping, and fellowshipping with other believers. Through Scripture and practical examples, we explore how discipleship requires more than just Sunday morning attendance—it's a daily commitment to sacrifice, worship, and fellowship.

item.title: The Family As God Designed
item.description: Explore key biblical truths from Genesis about how families were designed to reflect God's divine pattern, and learn how, even in brokenness, God provides a 'forever family' through His church. Join us as we unpack the challenges and blessings of family life, with practical insights for thriving in God's design.

item.title: Rest Principle
item.description: Parenting is demanding, but the Bible offers a powerful solution: the Rest Principle. Drawing from Matthew 28:18-20 and Paul David Tripp’s Gospel principles, this sermon encourages parents to find joy and peace in God’s presence, trust in His wisdom, and rely on His grace. Learn how resting in Christ equips you to be a more effective parent, helping your children grow as faithful disciples.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Goal
item.description: Explore the distinctive plea of the Church of Christ, urging us to unite under a common goal. This sermon dives deep into the biblical foundations of unity, drawing from the teachings of Jesus and Paul. Through thoughtful analogies and scriptural insight, we are called to overcome divisions and come together as one body in Christ. Join us as we reflect on the significance of unity in our faith and how we can embody this in our daily lives.

item.title: Control Principles
item.description: Explore how Gospel principles can transform parenting by focusing on heart change rather than mere behavioral control. Using Psalm 51 as a foundation, this sermon delves into the importance of guiding children towards genuine faith and self-control. Learn how to address the root issues of sin and instill the fruit of the Spirit in your children, ultimately leading them to a personal relationship with Christ. Discover practical ways to be a tool in God's hands as you parent with wisdom, love, and grace.

item.title: False Gods (Values) Principle
item.description: Explore the Gospel Principles for Parenting as we delve into the 'False Gods (Values) Principle.' Discover how what rules your child’s heart shapes their behavior and learn biblical strategies to guide them towards true worship. Join us as we discuss preventing the pitfalls of valuing feelings, creation, and trickery over faith, the Creator, and truth. Let’s reflect on how our worship influences our children and take steps towards genuine, God-centered parenting.

item.description: This sermon dives deep into the significance of being united by the Spirit's fruit, walk, and work, reflecting on powerful biblical teachings and real-life stories that inspire us to embrace selflessness, helpfulness, and love in our daily lives. Learn how we can all contribute to a Spirit-led community that transcends division and reflects God's glory in the world.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Baptism
item.description: Explore the distinctive plea of the Church of Christ as we delve into the powerful steps of faith, edification, and patience that unite us. Learn how the examples of Abraham, our brethren, and Christ Himself guide us toward unity in a divided world. This message challenges us to embrace the biblical steps of salvation and walk together in the steps of those who came before us. Join us for an inspiring journey through Scripture and practical illustrations that encourage faithfulness in every aspect of our Christian walk.

item.title: Character Principles
item.description: How does "bad thinking" shape our children's character? This insightful sermon explores the deep connection between thoughts and behavior, drawing from Ephesians 4 and Romans 1 to highlight how corrupted thinking leads to negative traits. But there’s hope! Learn how Christ transforms hearts and minds, offering a new path for our children. With practical guidance and Scriptural wisdom, discover how to instill the mind of Christ in your family today.

item.title: Foolishness Principles
item.description: Explore the transformative power of God's grace in parenting with this powerful sermon on the "Foolishness Principles." Learn how to guide your children through the inherent foolishness of the heart, using biblical wisdom to foster growth and understanding. Discover practical advice rooted in Scripture and the importance of instilling the message of the Cross, the things of the Spirit, and the wisdom of the Lord in young hearts. Perfect for parents seeking godly guidance in raising their children in today’s world.

item.title: Authority Principles
item.description: Explore gospel principles of parenting focusing on authority. Discover insights from the life of Joseph and biblical teachings on establishing and respecting authority in the family. Learn practical tips from Paul David Tripp on how to instill these values in your children, supported by scripture and real-life anecdotes. Join us as we delve into the challenges and blessings of parental authority, grounding our approach in the teachings of Christ.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Gospel
item.description: This sermon highlights the importance of unity in the Gospel, emphasizing its global reach through preaching, printing, and perceiving. Learn how the teachings of Jesus and the Apostles call us to spread the Gospel worldwide. Inspirational quotes and powerful scriptures remind us of our mission to share the good news with all. Discover how historical efforts in Bible translation bring us closer to fulfilling this mission. Tune in for a message that will inspire you to live out and share your faith!

item.title: Evil Principles
item.description: Discover how Gospel principles illuminate the true condition of our children's hearts and the urgent need for Jesus in their lives. This sermon explores biblical insights into the nature of sin and the transformative power of the Gospel, providing practical guidance for parents facing the challenges of raising children in a fallen world. Join us for an eye-opening and hope-filled message that underscores the importance of grace and the rescue only Christ can provide.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Cooperation
item.description: In this compelling sermon, we delve into the distinctive plea of the Church of Christ for unity through cooperation. Drawing from Acts, Corinthians, and other scriptural passages, we explore how churches can effectively collaborate in areas such as charity, mission work, and resolving controversies. Learn how early Christians exemplified unity and discover practical ways to foster cooperation within and between congregations today. Perfect for anyone seeking to strengthen their church community and deepen their understanding of biblical unity.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Organization
item.description: Explore the distinctive plea of the Church of Christ to be united through the biblical organization of elders. This sermon delves into historical divisions, scriptural mandates, and contemporary shifts toward elder-led governance, emphasizing the unity and growth that come from following the New Testament pattern. Join us in understanding how shepherds as regulators, overseers, caretakers, appointers, defenders, exemplars, and teachers keep the church united and thriving.

item.title: Gospel Principles
item.description: Explore the timeless gospel principles for parenting, focusing on the importance of understanding that change is a process, not an event. Through scriptural insights and practical examples, discover how to nurture your child's spiritual growth and maturity in a world that seeks instant results. Join us in understanding the continuous nature of parenting as reflected in the life and teachings of Jesus.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Plan
item.description: Join us in uncovering the hidden mysteries of God's plan through Christ, as we explore the unifying truths that bind us in faith. Discover how the secrets of grace, crucifixion, resurrection, gentiles, church, gospel, and everyone have been revealed to bring unity to the Church of Christ. Learn more about the divine plan that transforms and unites us all.

item.title: Identity Principles
item.description: Discover the transformative power of finding your identity in Christ rather than in your children. This sermon explores five key identity principles drawn from Jesus' act of foot washing in John 13, offering profound insights for parents. Learn how to shift your focus from your children's achievements to your spiritual relationship with God, embracing humility and service in your parenting journey.

item.description: Discover essential biblical principles for parenting, emphasizing our need for God's divine intervention. This sermon explores how true transformation in our children's hearts can only come from God's presence, gospel, and Spirit. Learn through inspiring anecdotes and powerful scriptures how to partner with God in your parenting journey. Strengthen your faith and embrace the support God offers in raising your children.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Worship
item.description: Explore how true worship brings unity among believers, inspired by Revelation 5:5-14 and heartfelt illustrations from "The Andy Griffith Show" and the story of the Little Brown Church in the Vale. Reflect on Jesus’ prayer and Paul’s preaching for unity, and discover the power of collective worship in our spiritual journey.

item.title: Law Principles
item.description: Discover transformative gospel principles for parenting, focusing on the balance between God's law and grace. Drawing insights from Paul David Tripp's "Parenting: 14 Gospel Principles That Can Radically Change Your Family," we delve into the essential role of grace in shaping our children's hearts. Learn how to navigate the challenges of legalism, embrace God's wisdom, and model grace in everyday parenting. Through the parable of the prodigal son and other biblical teachings, explore how grace redeems, seeks, and affirms. Join us on this journey of faith, love, and transformative parenting.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Cross
item.description: Discover the power of unity in the cross as we delve into the distinctive plea of the Church of Christ. From the consequences of sin to the ultimate reconciliation through Jesus' sacrifice, learn how the cross brings us together in faith. Join us for an insightful exploration grounded in scripture, with practical applications for today's believers.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Church
item.description: Discover the powerful call for unity within the Church of Christ in this thought-provoking sermon. Drawing from Scripture and historical insights, we explore why unity is essential, how it was emphasized by Jesus and Paul, and practical steps to achieve it. Join us in learning how to be united as one body in Christ.

item.title: Grace Principles
item.description: Discover the transformative power of God's grace in parenting with our video on Gospel Principles for Parenting. We explore how God equips and supports us, even in our weaknesses, highlighting key scriptures like Luke 22:32, John 14:18, and 2 Corinthians 12:7-10. Gain insights from Paul David Tripp's quote, "God never calls you to a task without giving you what you need to do it," and enjoy relatable stories that illustrate the practical applications of grace in everyday parenting. Join us to be encouraged and empowered by God’s unwavering presence and love.

item.title: Calling Principles
item.description: Unlock the secrets to effective parenting with the Gospel Principles for Parenting: Calling Principle. Dive deep into practical insights from Paul Tripp and timeless wisdom from Deuteronomy 6. Learn how to embed God's teachings in your heart, communicate His truths to your children, and create a home filled with His presence. Discover how authentic Christian faith in parents can profoundly impact the spiritual journey of their teens. Transform your parenting approach by becoming God's tool to form a human soul.

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Name
item.description: Discover the profound significance of unity in Jesus Christ through the lens of scripture, from Jesus' prayer for unity to Paul's exhortations against division. Learn why some divisions are necessary and how we can strive for a unity that respects diversity and maintains doctrinal integrity. This thought-provoking sermon will challenge and inspire you to make Jesus the focal point of our unity. Let's come together under His name and find common ground in our faith.

item.itunes:summary: Discover the profound significance of unity in Jesus Christ through the lens of scripture, from Jesus' prayer for unity to Paul's exhortations against division. item.title: Ambassadorship Principles
item.description: Discover the transformative power of ambassadorial parenting. Learn how to shift from ownership parenting to becoming a steward of God's will, raising children in His image. With biblical principles and practical guidance, understand the roles of reconcilers, revealers, and requesters as parents. Join us for a deep dive into parenting through the lens of faith and grace in this portion of "Gospel Principles For Parenting".

item.title: Let Us Be United By The Word
item.description: Discover the powerful message of unity in 'Let Us Be United By The Word.' This thought-provoking sermon is the first in the series "The Distinctive Plea of the Church of Christ", and delves into Jesus' prayer for unity, Paul's call for agreement, and the balancing act of maintaining doctrinal integrity. Join us as we explore the essential truths that bind us together, even amidst necessary divisions, and learn how to strengthen our community through the unchanging Word of God.

This thought-provoking sermon is the first in the series "The Distinctive Plea of the Church of Christ", and delves into Jesus' prayer for unity, Paul's call for agreement, and the balancing act of maintaining doctrinal integrity. Join us as we explore the essential truths that bind us together, even amidst necessary divisions, and learn how to strengthen our community through the unchanging Word of God.

item.title: Women of the Bible Abigail: God’s Preceding and Preventing Grace
item.description: Explore the profound story of Abigail, a woman of the Bible who exemplifies God's preceding and preventing grace. Discover how her actions mirror the concept of substitutionary atonement and reflect on the theological insights of prevenient grace from Augustine, Arminius, and Spurgeon. Learn practical ways to apply these lessons in your life and understand the depth of Jesus' sacrifice for humanity. Join us as we delve into this inspiring biblical narrative and draw closer to God's manifold grace.

item.title: The Effects of Understanding God’s Plan of Salvation
item.description: Join us in this enlightening sermon as we explore the profound impacts of understanding God’s plan of salvation. Through key scriptures like Romans 12:1-2 and Hosea 4:6, we uncover how this understanding results in motivation, transformation, and demonstration in our daily lives.

item.title: Tell Your Story
item.description: Each of us is living a story that contributes to God’s greater narrative. In this inspiring message, explore how our experiences—whether joyful, sorrowful, or extraordinary—fit into the eternal story God is writing. Through personal testimonies, biblical accounts, and reflections on faith, this sermon challenges graduates and believers alike to embrace their journeys, build connections in Christian fellowship, and let the Gospel shape their legacy. A call to walk with wisdom, share the Gospel, and glorify God in every chapter of life.

In this inspiring message, explore how our experiences—whether joyful, sorrowful, or extraordinary—fit into the eternal story God is writing. Through personal testimonies, biblical accounts, and reflections on faith, this sermon challenges graduates and believers alike to embrace their journeys, build connections in Christian fellowship, and let the Gospel shape their legacy. A call to walk with wisdom, share the Gospel, and glorify God in every chapter of life.

item.title: God’s Path For Your Life
item.description: Join us as we explore how to find God's path for your life through a captivating sermon inspired by Proverbs 4. Discover the importance of avoiding the sinner's path, seeking the shining path, and pondering the straight path with engaging stories and practical biblical insights. Learn how to stay true to your purpose and navigate life's challenges with God's guidance. This sermon is packed with relatable examples, scriptural wisdom, and thought-provoking reflections. Perfect for anyone looking to deepen their faith and find direction in their spiritual journey. Don't miss this opportunity to grow closer to God and understand His plan for your life!

item.title: A Humble Ambitious Mother
item.description: Explore the profound message of "A Humble Ambitious Mother," examining Salome's request for her sons in Matthew 20:20-28. Learn the difference between humility and overconfidence, and how mothers can ambitiously seek blessings while staying grounded in Christ's teachings. Hear inspiring historical anecdotes from Charles Spurgeon's mother, William Booth, and Napoleon Bonaparte as we uncover how true ambition should always be guided by faith, love, and service.

item.title: The Qualities of a Mother in Israel
item.description: Explore the surprising qualities of a 'Mother in Israel' in this in-depth sermon based on 2 Samuel 20:16-22. Learn how ancient biblical mothers like the wise woman of Abel, Eve, and Rebekah demonstrated wisdom, humility, and faithfulness amidst adversity. Discover how their stories offer valuable lessons for today's mothers, emphasizing the importance of authenticity, courage, and biblical principles.

item.title: Reporting on What Mission Work Taught Us
item.description: Join us as we navigate the teachings of Acts and Corinthians to delve into the heart of missionary work, emphasizing the importance of sharing good reports that glorify God and inspire the church community. Whether you're a long-time missionary supporter or new to understanding this vital aspect of Christian life, this message is for you.

item.title: Made Whole by God
item.description: Explore the transformative power of God’s authority in restoring our brokenness to wholeness for His glory. This sermon dives into Ezekiel 36, the sanctifying work of the Holy Spirit, and the ultimate glorification awaiting believers. Reflect on how God’s unwavering commitment to His holy name shapes our journey from sin to salvation. An inspiring message reminding us that God is in control, working to restore us for His glory, and inviting us to embrace His call today.

item.title: I and the Father are One
item.description: Explore the profound scriptural evidence for the divinity of Jesus Christ, as we compare Christian and Islamic views of Jesus, unpack key Bible verses, and reflect on the significance of worshiping the Lamb who is worthy. This powerful message delves into why Jesus's divinity matters for salvation, how His sacrifice bridges the gap between God and humanity, and why all creation proclaims His glory. Don't miss this thought-provoking sermon filled with biblical insights and a heartfelt call to worship the one true Savior.

item.title: Walking on Water
item.description: Explore Peter’s incredible moment of walking on water and learn how his faith, tested amidst the storm, provides lessons for our own lives. This inspiring message dives into three key points: how faith is forged outside of our comfort zones, why it must remain focused on Christ, and how it strengthens us to face life's chaos without fear. Join us as we unpack Matthew 14:28-30 and discover how God works through every storm to build a deeper reliance on Him. Perfect for anyone seeking encouragement and perspective during difficult times.

item.title: God Shaped Holiness
item.description: Are you searching for something to fill the void in your life? This powerful message explores the "God-shaped hole" we all experience and how only God's holiness can make us whole. Journey through scripture, from Exodus to Revelation, as we uncover the profound transformation made possible through Jesus Christ. Learn about God's sanctifying power, the holiness of His presence, and the living water that sustains us. Don't miss this inspiring and hope-filled lesson on how Christ completes us and empowers us to share His love with the world.

item.title: Job's Application of the Armor of God
item.description: How did Job endure unimaginable trials while staying faithful to God? This powerful sermon explores the parallels between Job's perseverance and the spiritual armor described in Ephesians 6. Learn how Job embodied the belt of truth, breastplate of righteousness, and more as he faced relentless attacks from Satan. Discover practical insights for your own battles and see how faith, truth, and God's Word provide the ultimate defense. An inspiring message that will strengthen your spiritual walk!

item.title: God Shaped Hole
item.description: Struggling with an inner void you can't seem to fill? This heartfelt sermon explores the "God-shaped hole" in every human soul—a longing only God can satisfy. Drawing from Scripture and personal experiences, the message reveals how worldly pursuits often leave us empty and how Jesus provides the ultimate peace, purpose, and rest. Learn about four compelling reasons to trust in Christ and how He alone fulfills our deepest desires.

item.title: Revisiting Righteous Anger
item.description: Dive into the profound teachings of Matthew 18:21–35 as we explore the concept of 'Righteous Anger' from a biblical perspective. We will unpack the source of the term righteous anger compared to scripture. Discover why anger, although a natural human emotion, cannot coexist with the righteousness God wants. Join us on this journey towards understanding, healing, and radical forgiveness.

item.title: An Evasion and Demonstration of Repentance
item.description: Explore the powerful contrast between King Saul's evasion of repentance and King David's heartfelt demonstration of true repentance. Through 1 Samuel 15 and 2 Samuel 12, this lesson reveals the tactics we often use to avoid repentance and the transformative power of genuine confession and humility before God. Learn why repentance is essential for forgiveness, how God's love calls us to confront sin, and the joy that comes with His mercy. Reflect on your own response to sin and discover the path to spiritual renewal.

item.title: Reliable Testimonials That Prove the Resurrection of Jesus Christ
item.description: Explore the undeniable evidence of Jesus' Resurrection through the transformative testimonies of Paul, James, and John. This sermon weaves together nature's rebirth, historical facts, and personal stories to reveal the power of the risen Christ. Discover how the Resurrection changes everything and invites us to believe and proclaim the good news with joy and conviction. Join us as we delve into the heart of Christian faith and witness the undeniable proof of Jesus' victory over death.

item.title: Finding My Purpose In The Lord
item.description: Discover the pathway to finding your purpose in the Lord with this enlightening sermon. Explore how trust, delight, commitment, representation, and patience are not just virtues but steps ordered by God to guide us to our true calling. Learn from biblical wisdom, practical insights, and inspiring stories that reveal the beauty of living a purpose-driven life anchored in faith. Whether you're seeking direction, affirmation, or a deeper understanding of your spiritual journey, this message offers a clear, scriptural foundation to find your purpose in the embrace of the Lord's will.

item.title: Inherited Tendencies of the Knowledge of Good and Evil
item.description: Explore the profound truths behind our inherited tendencies towards sin and the transformative hope found in Jesus Christ. This sermon delves into the biblical narrative, from the Fall in Genesis to the redemption offered through Christ's sacrifice, providing a deep understanding of sin's impact and the path to salvation. Discover how the knowledge of good and evil shapes us, the role of Jesus in our redemption, and the importance of personal responsibility and faith. Join us on a journey through Scripture to find hope and grace in the good news of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Finding My Purpose in God's Manifestations
item.description: Delve into the significance of our daily actions and learn how even the smallest tasks can align with our divine calling. Discover the impact of historical figures like William Osler and Albert Einstein on understanding our purpose, all through a blend of humor, historical anecdotes, and Scripture. Whether you're seeking guidance on finding your purpose or looking to deepen your spiritual journey, this message offers invaluable insights into living a purpose-driven life. Join us as we uncover how to fully embrace and manifest God's purpose for us, making every moment count.

item.title: Five Steps of Spiritual Growth for a Disciple or an Apprentice of Christ
item.description: Explore the transformative journey of becoming a disciple of Christ with "Five Steps of Spiritual Growth for a Disciple or an Apprentice of Christ." Delve into the essential stages every believer embarks on, from being sanctified as a Saint to serving with humility, embracing lifelong learning as a Student, enduring as a Sufferer, and finally, empowering others as a Sender. Uncover how these steps guide us closer to embodying Christ's teachings in our daily lives, illustrating that discipleship is not just about knowledge or skills, but about becoming a reflection of Christ to the world. Join us to discover how you can embark on this spiritual journey, fostering a deeper, more meaningful connection with Christ and those around you.

item.title: Finding My Purpose In God’s Purpose
item.description: Through the wisdom of Romans 8:28-29 and engaging anecdotes, discover the joy and fulfillment in embracing God's call, love, and predestination. Unveil the steps towards being conformed to the image of Christ and how this shapes our ultimate joy and purpose in life. Whether you're seeking direction, affirmation, or a deeper understanding of your spiritual journey, this message offers valuable insights into finding your unique place in God's grand narrative.

item.title: The True Teachings of Christ in Practice
item.description: Discover how Christ's emphasis on practice over theory guides us towards making small, meaningful adjustments in our lives. Inspired by the real-life story of Play-Doh's invention, this sermon beautifully illustrates how we're all just one small adjustment away from aligning our lives more closely with Christ's teachings. From being misjudged to misguided, and misbehaving, learn how to see through Christ's eyes and become His apprentice in the way of love, kindness, and righteousness. Whether you're looking to deepen your faith or find practical ways to live out Christ's teachings every day, this sermon offers wisdom and insight for everyone.

item.title: Finding My Purpose In God’s Thoughts
item.description: Dive into the heart of finding your purpose through God's lens with our latest sermon, "Finding My Purpose In God’s Thoughts." Unpack the profound truths hidden within Jeremiah 29:11-14, as we explore how God's plans, peace, and purpose shape our lives. Through engaging stories, biblical insights, and a touch of humor, this message invites you on a journey to deeper understanding and fulfillment. Discover how aligning with God's thoughts can transform your perspective on life's purpose. Join us for an enlightening exploration of finding true meaning and direction in the divine plans God has for each of us.

item.title: Saul’s Path to Being Rejected and Replaced
item.description: Explore the riveting story of King Saul's rise and fall in "Saul’s Path to Being Rejected and Replaced". This sermon delves into the biblical narrative of 1 Samuel, offering profound insights into the dangers of disobedience, the deceitfulness of appearances, and the devastating consequences of losing God's presence. Through Saul's journey, learn the critical importance of spiritual integrity and the hope of redemption through obedience to God. Join us as we uncover the lessons Saul's story holds for personal growth and spiritual renewal.

item.title: One Receives The Prize!
item.description: Explore the depths of your purpose with 'One Receives The Prize!' – a compelling journey through scripture that challenges us to live a life glorifying God. Discover the essential elements of realization, restraint, resolve, and rules through a diverse array of biblical passages. This sermon will guide you towards understanding your life's ultimate goal: to honor God in all you do. Whether you're seeking direction or inspiration to elevate your spiritual journey, this message offers valuable insights into achieving a purpose-driven life that aligns with God's glory. Join us as we delve into a transformative exploration of faith, purpose, and the pursuit of an imperishable crown.

item.title: Keeping Worship Special
item.description: Explore the sacredness of worship in 'Keeping Worship Special,' a sermon that delves into the biblical significance of worship as a unique and holy experience. Through the metaphor of smell and a touching modern-day story, this message invites us to reflect on how we approach worship, encouraging us to create a special, sensory, and sacred space that honors God. Discover how ancient practices can guide our worship today, making it a pleasing aroma to the Lord. This sermon reminds us of the importance of respecting and cherishing our worship experiences, drawing closer to God with every breath.

item.title: Coping With Our Fears - Part 3
item.description: Welcome to the third part of our transformative sermon series, "Coping with Our Fears," where we explore the dynamic role of faith in addressing the anxieties that challenge us daily. In this segment, we delve into the power of scripture, drawing from Philippians 4:6-7 and other pivotal verses, to present humor-filled, relatable narratives alongside deep spiritual insights. Learn about the four pillars of coping with anxiety through faith: prayer, peace, protection, and the power of God. We dissect common fears with practical examples—ranging from humorous hypotheticals to everyday worries—showcasing how these concerns often hold less substance than we might think. This sermon offers an in-depth look at the unnecessary nature of most anxieties and provides biblical strategies for shifting our focus from fear to faith. Highlighting the significance of prayer, the peace that comes from trusting God, the protection offered by faith, and the strength found in Christ, we're guided on how to transform our approach to life's uncertainties.

item.description: Discover how common fears among believers, from financial loss to the dread of judgment day, can be overcome through faith, scriptural wisdom, and the transformative power of God's love. Join us for a faith-affirming session that promises to uplift and inspire.

item.title: Double Trouble
item.description: Explore the powerful theme of 'Double Trouble' in this enlightening sermon, as we delve into biblical stories of curses and blessings to uncover the dangers of duplicity in faith. Discover how ancient narratives and modern-day distractions reveal the importance of a single-minded devotion to God. Learn practical steps to avoid the pitfalls of being double-hearted, double-minded, and double-tongued, and how to embrace a life of focused faithfulness. Join us on a journey from the perils of divided loyalty to the peace of unwavering commitment to what is right and true.

item.title: Coping With Our Fears - Part 2
item.description: Discover how scriptures like Isaiah 41:10 and 2 Timothy 1:7 guide us towards a sound mind, love, and power over fear. From personal anecdotes to divine truths, learn how faith in God's presence, godliness, helpfulness, and righteousness can transform fear into faithfulness. Whether it's fear of the unknown or everyday anxieties, this sermon offers insights for anyone looking to find peace and courage through their faith.

item.title: Coping With Our Fears - Part 1
item.description: Explore the depths of faith and fear with our enlightening sermon "Coping With Our Fears." Delve into how understanding God's promises, presence, and purposes provides us with the strength to face our darkest fears. From personal stories across the globe to the wisdom of Psalms and the insightful experiments of Curt Paul Richter, this sermon offers hope and guidance for navigating the valleys of life. Discover how to anchor your soul in hope and emerge fearless, no matter the challenges. Join us on this transformative journey to overcoming fear with faith.

item.title: How to Incline My Heart to Obey God Forever
item.description: Discover the transformative journey of inclining your heart to obey God forever in our latest sermon. Drawing inspiration from Psalm 119:112-116, we explore the profound shift from performing religious duties to embodying a spirit of true obedience and devotion. Learn how to cultivate a deep-seated aversion to spiritual instability, find solace and protection in the Lord, and place unwavering hope in His Word. Join us as we navigate through the three key inclinations that can transform your relationship with God: hating all forms of instability, hiding in the Lord during times of trouble, and hoping in God's Word as the ultimate source of truth and salvation. This sermon is not just about what we do but about who we are inclined to be in the Spirit.

Drawing inspiration from Psalm 119:112-116, we explore the profound shift from performing religious duties to embodying a spirit of true obedience and devotion. Learn how to cultivate a deep-seated aversion to spiritual instability, find solace and protection in the Lord, and place unwavering hope in His Word. Join us as we navigate through the three key inclinations that can transform your relationship with God: hating all forms of instability, hiding in the Lord during times of trouble, and hoping in God's Word as the ultimate source of truth and salvation. This sermon is not just about what we do but about who we are inclined to be in the Spirit.

item.title: Vision for Creekside
item.description: How can we create a thriving, Christ-centered community that draws others in and glorifies God? In this inspiring message, we explore Paul's journey, the importance of knowing scripture, and the call to evangelize with passion, perseverance, and purpose. Learn how your personal relationship with Jesus can shine as a testimony to others and bring hope to a world in need. This sermon challenges us to reflect on three pivotal questions: Who is Jesus to you? How is your relationship with Him? And what hope do you have in Him? Embrace this vision for community and personal growth today.

item.title: Profane Improvements
item.description: Is our desire to "improve" worship drawing us closer to God—or further away? This sermon explores the biblical principle of simplicity in worship, emphasizing unaltered devotion and the dangers of modern innovations that distract from God’s design. Drawing from Exodus 20:25 and powerful illustrations like the Japanese art of Kintsugi, we learn how God’s beauty is revealed in brokenness and simplicity. Join us as we refocus on worship that honors God without profaning the sacred.

item.title: We Must Remember Purity
item.description: Explore the essence of spiritual purity in 'What We Must Remember Part 3: Remember Purity'. Delve into a thought-provoking journey through Revelation 3:1-6 and other key Scriptures, discovering how to maintain purity in a challenging world. Laugh, reflect, and grow with an unforgettable illustration about three boys and their dads. Join us in understanding how purity isn't just about the flesh but encompasses our whole being, as we seek to live worthy lives before God.

item.title: Why We Can Not Help Everyone - Part 2
item.description: Dive into the depths of human constraints in 'Why We Can Not Help Everyone - Part 2'. This thought-provoking sermon ventures beyond conventional understanding, focusing on the limitations not just within us, but also in those we strive to assist. Harnessing a blend of biblical narratives, modern analogies, and a touch of humor, this message sheds light on the intricate challenges of aiding others while embracing our own limitations. Engage in this enlightening exploration that intertwines spiritual insights with everyday realities, fostering a deeper comprehension of our roles in others' lives according to the principles of Luke 22 and other scriptures. Witness a unique perspective on service, patience, and understanding in our spiritual walk.

item.title: We Must Remember Love
item.description: Explore the profound lessons from Luke 15 in this heartfelt sermon focusing on the parables of the Lost Sheep, the Lost Coin, and the Prodigal Son. Beyond the familiar message of God's relentless love and forgiveness, we examine the often-overlooked perspective of the "other brother"—a challenge to our attitudes toward blessings, fairness, and God's faithfulness. Are we celebrating with heaven, or are we harboring resentment? A thought-provoking reflection for anyone seeking a deeper connection with God's Word.

Join us for a journey of faith, introspection, and empowerment through Christ's wisdom.

item.description: Explore the profound significance of remembering Christ in this enlightening sermon. Uncover the importance of His body, blood, and bringing, and how these elements shape our faith and relationship with God. This sermon is a call to remember, reflect, and revere the sacrifice and teachings of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ruth's Suffering, Redemption, and God's Hand in the Mundane
item.description: Explore the timeless story of Ruth, Naomi, and Boaz—a journey from heartbreak to redemption that reveals God's invisible hand weaving together an incredible plan. This sermon dives deep into the lessons of loyalty, faith, and trust in God's purpose, even in our darkest times. Learn how Ruth's bold choices, Naomi's steadfast faith, and Boaz's integrity point us to Jesus Christ, our ultimate Kinsman Redeemer. Perfect for reflecting on how God works in the mundane and transforms lives through love and grace.

Discover how God's guidance in the past can shape our present and future. Perfect for those seeking comfort and direction in their faith journey.

Don't let the holiday stress get to you - learn how to thrive, not just survive, by giving your worries to Jesus.

item.title: When The World Said Christians Were Bad
item.description: Explore the trials and tribulations faced by Christians throughout history and in the modern world in this enlightening sermon. Drawing on scripture and historical references, we delve into the accusations and misconceptions that have been leveled against Christians, from the early days of the faith to the present. Discover how Christianity has thrived despite opposition and consider how you can stand firm in your faith amidst worldly challenges. Join us for this thought-provoking journey through history and faith.

item.description: In this heartfelt sermon, we journey through the history of the iconic WWJD movement, uncover lessons of responsibility, selfless service, and unconditional love demonstrated by Jesus Christ. With examples from Scripture and modern-day reflections, learn how to embrace Jesus’ example in your community, work, and relationships. Be inspired to live with purpose and humility, asking daily how you can reflect His love.

Tune in to deepen your understanding and strengthen your spiritual defenses.

item.title: It’s Hard to Get from Here to There
item.description: Join us as we explore the trials and triumphs of faith in our sermon, "It's Hard to Get from Here to There." Drawing from personal experiences and the lives of biblical figures, we delve into the hardships we face and the blessings we receive as we journey in faith. Discover how faith can guide us through life's challenges and lead us to blessings beyond our imagination. This sermon is a testament to the enduring power of faith, and a reminder that with God, all things are possible.

item.title: Meals with Jesus
item.description: Discover the profound significance of meals in the Bible in "Meals with Jesus". Journey through ten biblical stories of meals involving Jesus, and uncover their implications for Christian fellowship, communion, and our relationship with God. From the multiplication of wine at a wedding to the final celebratory meal in Revelation, each meal carries a miraculous message or miracle. Join us as we delve into these stories and explore how they speak to different places within us.

item.title: If a man dies, shall he live again?
item.description: Embark on a spiritual journey as we grapple with the profound question, "If a man dies, shall he live again?", the fifth in the series of "Questions that Deserve an Answer". This sermon takes you on a deep dive into the Book of Job to the New Testament. We'll explore the intricate tapestry of life, death, and what comes after, guided by the divine wisdom of God's creation, conclusion, and considerations. This sermon is an essential watch for those seeking solace, comprehension, and hope amidst the inevitability of mortality.

Through the books of James, Proverbs, and other scriptures, we will explore the pitfalls of self-elevation and the importance of seeking wisdom from God and others. Discover how to avoid foolishness by learning from past mistakes, listening more, and making peace.

item.description: Dive into the second sermon in the series of questions that deserve an answer. In this lesson we will discover the five reasons why we should answer 'Yes' to being our brother's keeper, and how this responsibility extends to various aspects of our lives. This sermon is a must-watch for anyone seeking to deepen their understanding of Christian responsibility and brotherhood.

item.title: Preparation for Organizational Division
item.description: Dive into part three of this series, "Thinking Inside The Box" where we explore the biblical teachings on handling church divisions. This sermon is a must-watch for anyone seeking guidance on maintaining unity and peace within their church community. It's packed with wisdom from Acts 20:17-38, providing practical steps to prevent division and promote harmony. Discover how to remain unmoved by plots, panic, pain, perusals, phonies, philosophies, and prosperity. Join us as we learn to stand firm in our faith and commitment to the church, just as Jesus did.

item.description: Explore the historical and theological perspectives of tithing from the Patriarchal Age to the Christian Age, and discover why Jesus, being of the Order of Melchizedek, is worthy to receive tithes. This sermon is a treasure trove of biblical references, historical facts, and thought-provoking insights that will enrich your understanding of giving in the Christian faith.

item.title: Jesus Taught You Ought Tithe Strictly
item.description: Journey through scriptures from both Old and New Testaments, to explore the significance of supporting the church and those in need. Discover the spiritual benefits of giving in your walk with God.
item.itunes:author: Creekside Church of Christ

item.title: Preparation for Usual Unusual Things
item.description: Join us as we explore the importance of 'inside the box' thinking for church leaders, drawing from the wisdom of Jesus, Peter, James, and John. Discover how exposure to manifestations, miracles, and miseries can shape us into strong leaders. This sermon is a must-watch for Elders, Deacons, Preachers, Teachers, and potential leaders.

item.title: It Takes What It Takes: Working for the Lord
item.description: Explore the work of the church through the lens of availability, accountability, and adaptability, drawing wisdom from Nehemiah’s efforts to rebuild Jerusalem’s wall. Reflecting on hard work in our daily lives and applying it to serving God, this message challenges us to adopt a mindset of dedication, inspired by Christ's ultimate example of sacrifice. Whether you're looking to deepen your faith or find motivation in serving your community, this lesson will inspire action and spiritual growth. Don't miss this practical and uplifting call to service!
