item.title: Jesus Taught the Kingdom Is Worth It All
item.description: Explore the difference between debt and investment, both in our worldly lives and in our spiritual journey. Drawing from personal anecdotes and humor, we delve into the true value of the Kingdom of God and why it's worth investing everything we have. We also examine various biblical passages to understand the pitfalls of giving with the wrong intentions. This sermon is a call to reflect on our spiritual investments and to prioritize the Kingdom of God above all else. Tune in and let's grow in faith together. Don't forget to like, share, and subscribe for more inspiring messages.

item.description: Join us as we journey through biblical passages and historical anecdotes that highlight the transformative impact of prayer on individuals and communities. item.description: Dive into this enlightening sermon exploring the impact of schools of thought on creativity, drawing parallels from the Bible and modern society. item.title: Where They Found Young Jesus
item.description: Explore the life of young Jesus with us. This sermon delves into the scriptures of Luke 2:39-52, revealing where Jesus was found and how he grew in wisdom and stature. Discover the importance of the House of God, the role of teachers, and the power of studying scripture. This sermon is a must-watch for anyone seeking to deepen their understanding of Jesus' early life and the lessons we can learn from it.

item.title: Spiritual Recalibration
item.description: What does it mean to recalibrate your spiritual life? In this heartfelt and practical message, Brian Smith shares his personal journey through life's highs and lows, illustrating the importance of recalibration in our walk with Christ. Drawing from Scripture, Brian emphasizes love as the cornerstone of our faith and offers five practical steps to help us realign our spiritual lives for growth and deeper connection with God. From challenging societal pressures to embracing radical love, this sermon is a call to action for every believer. Don't miss these transformative insights into living out your faith with intention, courage, and love.

item.title: Our Body Image is Different
item.description: A comprehensive exploration of the concept of 'body image' in the context of the church, drawing parallels between physical, mental, and spiritual perceptions of self and the collective body of Christ.

item.title: Big Picture Faith
item.description: Where is God in our suffering? Drawing insights from Psalm 73, this sermon by Keegan Wilson explores Asaph's raw struggle with injustice, the prosperity of the wicked, and his journey toward faith, hope, and love in God's ultimate justice. Through real-life stories, powerful scripture, and practical applications, we are reminded to focus on the big picture—God's enduring love and justice that meet at the cross. Find strength, trust, and purpose, even in life’s hardest trials.

item.title: Dealing with Symptoms but not the Real Problem
item.description: Are we only treating the symptoms in our lives, or are we seeking the true cure? This powerful lesson challenges us to dig deeper into the root causes of both physical and spiritual struggles. Using biblical examples, such as King Asa's health struggles (2 Chronicles 16:12-13), the paralyzed man healed by Jesus (Luke 5:18-26), and Hezekiah’s prayer (2 Kings 20:1-7), we explore how faith, repentance, and reliance on Christ are key to lasting transformation. Learn how to focus on the "why" instead of the "what" and how Jesus provides the ultimate cure for sin. Perfect for anyone yearning for deeper spiritual insight and a closer relationship with Christ. Be inspired to confront the deeper issues in your walk with God!

item.title: Pride Before a Fall
item.description: Explore the biblical dangers of pride and its contrast with humility through this compelling sermon rooted in Scripture. Drawing from 2 Timothy 3:1, Proverbs 16:18, and other key passages, the message unveils how pride is baseless, graceless, shapeless, and defenseless—ultimately leading to destruction. Illustrated with historical examples, cultural observations, and biblical narratives, this lesson calls for a humble approach to God and life. Perfect for anyone seeking to deepen their understanding of humility and avoid the pitfalls of arrogance. Join us for this thought-provoking journey into Scripture!

item.title: Self Control
item.description: Explore the essential biblical principles of self-control through this thought-provoking sermon. From overcoming anger and destructive habits to practicing restraint in daily life, you'll uncover practical steps rooted in Scripture to strengthen your walk with God. Featuring key insights from Galatians 5:22-23, Romans 7:15-22, and 1 Corinthians 9:24-27, this lesson emphasizes reliance on the Holy Spirit to develop mastery over oneself. Join us in learning how to apply the "10 Commandments of Self-Control" and find encouragement to live a life that honors Christ. Perfect for anyone seeking spiritual growth and deeper understanding of God's Word.

item.title: Faithfulness
item.description: Explore the true meaning of faithfulness as we reflect on God's steadfast love and our calling to remain faithful in every area of life—our homes, ministries, marriages, and even moments of personal challenge. Through scripture, practical insights, and heartfelt examples, this message invites us to trust in the unchanging faithfulness of God and embrace our own responsibilities as stewards of His blessings. Be inspired by the timeless hymn "Great Is Thy Faithfulness" and discover how to live a life that honors His trustworthiness.

item.title: Gentleness
item.description: How can we cultivate the fruit of gentleness in a world that often values harshness? In this powerful sermon, we explore the biblical foundations of gentleness as a Christ-like virtue, drawing on practical examples and scripture. From handling conflicts with care to restoring others in love, discover how to embody gentleness in your daily walk with God. Featuring stories of wisdom, humor, and grace, this message reminds us that gentleness is not weakness but strength under control, rooted in humility and the Spirit's work. Scriptures like Matthew 11:29, Galatians 6:1, and James 3:17 guide us toward becoming gentle yet firm reflections of Christ.

item.title: Goodness
item.description: How can we be good when we fall short daily? This sermon explores the concept of goodness as a gift from God, not something we achieve on our own. With insights from Genesis to Galatians, you'll learn how God's Spirit transforms hearts, shapes character, and offers a pardon for all through Jesus Christ. Whether struggling with self-righteousness or searching for hope, this message reminds us of the ultimate power of God's grace and love. Will you accept the pardon? Watch now and be inspired to walk in the Spirit!

item.title: Therefore I have Hope
item.description: What does true hope look like in the life of a Christian? This heartfelt sermon, inspired by Lamentations and 1 Peter 3:15, explores the depth of God's mercies, faithfulness, and goodness. Learn how to differentiate between fleeting optimism and lasting biblical hope, and discover practical ways to reflect God's love to a world in need. Filled with powerful Scripture references and relatable illustrations, this message encourages believers to trust in God's promises even in the midst of life's struggles. Tune in for an inspiring call to anchor your hope in Christ!

item.title: Kindness
item.description: Explore the profound impact of kindness as we reflect on its divine origins and how it manifests in our lives. This heartfelt message delves into the fruits of the Spirit, practical ways to embody kindness, and the life-changing effects it can have on others. Featuring uplifting scripture like Isaiah 54:8-10, Galatians 5:22, and Titus 3:4-5, this sermon calls us to reflect God's love through our actions, even in challenging moments. Includes inspiring stories that remind us of the eternal value of simple, kind acts. Join us in embracing kindness as a powerful force for change.

item.title: Peace
item.description: Discover the transformative power of spiritual peace in this heartfelt message. Learn how peace, a gift of the Holy Spirit, is not just something to possess but a way of life to walk in. Through biblical insights from Galatians 5:22-25, Isaiah 26:3, and Philippians 4:7, this sermon explores seven aspects of spiritual peace—spiritual wellness, completeness, preparedness, oneness, fullness, blessedness, and fearlessness. Hear personal stories, thought-provoking illustrations, and an invitation to experience the lasting peace only Christ provides. Whether you're searching for inner calm or guidance in life's storms, this message will inspire you to embrace the peace that surpasses all understanding.

item.title: Patience
item.description: Patience is both a divine gift and a personal choice. This sermon explores the multifaceted nature of patience as described in Galatians 5 and James 5, illustrating it through practical lessons, biblical examples, and a moving Jewish parable. Learn how to patiently endure life’s trials, exonerate others, and prepare for Christ’s return, while growing in your faith and trust in God’s perfect timing. A powerful message that challenges believers to walk in the Spirit and embrace patience in their relationships with God and others.

item.title: Joy
item.description: Explore the deeper meaning of joy as a fruit of the Spirit in this inspiring sermon. Learn how true joy stems from our relationship with God, transcending life's struggles, sorrows, and circumstances. With biblical insights from passages like Psalm 51:12, Romans 15:13, and Luke 6:22-23, discover how joy is not mere happiness but a calm assurance rooted in God's promises. This message will encourage you to embrace the joy of salvation, fellowship, and the hope of eternity with Christ. Don't miss this uplifting reflection on the transformative power of joy!

item.title: Love
item.description: What is real love, and how does it differ from the hollow promises and fleeting emotions of the world? Through Scripture, personal stories, and powerful illustrations, this sermon explores the immeasurable depth of God’s love, highlighting its expressions, experiences, and examples. Reflect on passages like 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5, uncovering how God's love surpasses human understanding and calls us to a higher standard. Whether you’re seeking encouragement or clarity, this message will inspire you to embrace and share true, Christ-centered love.

item.title: The Endurance Given For Evangelism
item.description: Evangelism can feel daunting, but it remains central to the Christian mission. In this empowering sermon, explore three enduring sources of strength for sharing the gospel: the power of God's proclamation, the persuasive nature of His Word, and the protective hand of His presence. Learn why failure isn't final and how even small efforts can lead to great spiritual victories. Packed with inspiring stories, scriptural insights, and a call to action, this message will reignite your passion for spreading the good news.

item.title: Luke 3
item.description: What Then Shall We Do? Explore the profound teachings of John the Baptist in Luke 3, where he calls us to examine our lives in preparation for the coming King. This sermon challenges us to produce fruits of repentance, share generously with those in need, and avoid justifying immoral actions for personal gain. Through a deep dive into the historical and scriptural context, discover how this message still resonates today. A timely reminder that the King's return is imminent—are we ready?

item.title: Honor Your Father And Mother
item.description: What does it mean to honor your parents? This message unpacks seven key ways to show respect and gratitude for the sacrifices, love, and guidance of your parents—while also addressing the vital role forgiveness plays in parent-child relationships. Learn how honoring your parents connects to God's promises of long life, blessings, and an eternal home. Whether you're a parent, a child, or both, this thought-provoking lesson will inspire a deeper understanding of love, grace, and biblical obedience.

item.title: Crossroads of Life
item.description: At the crossroads of life, what will you choose? This heartfelt message draws powerful lessons from Robert Johnson’s story, the choices of Cain and Abel, and the faith of Noah to inspire us to give our best to God. Reflect on the ultimate sacrifice of Jesus Christ and how His example calls us to live with faith, courage, and purpose. A compelling reminder to aim upward and embrace the hope, love, and peace found in Christ.

item.title: A Life Unaffected
item.description: How can we live a life undeterred by criticism, negativity, or setbacks? Drawing inspiration from Mark 6:1–13, this sermon explores the resilience of Christ in the face of rejection and challenges us to adopt His unwavering commitment to righteousness. Learn practical lessons about persistence through real-life stories, timeless scripture, and the power of focusing on the cross. Perfect for anyone seeking encouragement to persevere through life's trials.

item.title: Critical Grace Theory
item.description: Explore the transformative power of God's grace through the lens of "Critical Grace Theory." This engaging message unpacks the depth of divine mercy for the unhappy, the unlawful, the unfaithful, and even the unbelieving. Discover how scripture calls us to humility, reliance on grace, and unity in Christ. Thought-provoking and filled with practical applications, this lesson challenges legalism and inspires faith in the unmatched love of God. Perfect for those seeking to understand salvation beyond works and embrace the fullness of grace.

item.title: The Duties of a Christian Man For His Woman
item.description: What does it mean to be the man God calls you to be? This thought-provoking message explores the duties of a Christian man as an initiator, worker, teacher, definer, and partner. Rooted in Genesis 3:16 and practical insights, this lesson challenges men to rise above cultural stereotypes, embody relentless responsibility, and honor the women in their lives. Whether you're married, single, or seeking spiritual growth, this sermon offers timeless truths for becoming a man of integrity and faith. Watch to reflect on God's design for manhood and the transformative power of Christ in our relationships.

item.title: The Meaning of Eve
item.description: Names carry profound meaning, shaping identity and purpose. This sermon explores the biblical significance of names, focusing on Eve, the "Mother of All Living," and the eternal life she foreshadowed through Christ. Discover how names in Scripture reflect God’s plan, from Adam's faith in naming Eve to the name above all names, Jesus. Embrace the value of your God-given identity, the heritage of motherhood, and the power of faith. Join us for this inspiring message celebrating the divine purpose in every name.

Embrace the value of your God-given identity, the heritage of motherhood, and the power of faith. Join us for this inspiring message celebrating the divine purpose in every name.

item.title: Comparing a Few Words on Worship
item.description: Are we too focused on comparing ourselves to others—even in worship? This thought-provoking sermon dives into Jesus' conversation with the Samaritan woman (John 4) to reveal the dangers of comparison in worship and life. Learn why worshiping in spirit and truth transcends places, practices, and people, leading us to the ultimate example of true worship: Jesus Christ. A call to humility, unity, and heartfelt devotion awaits in this powerful message.

item.title: No Tears in Heaven
item.description: Explore the profound promise of Revelation 21:1-4 and its roots in Isaiah 25, as this heartfelt sermon delves into the concept of "No Tears in Heaven." Through poignant reflections on eternal joy, the bodily resurrection, and personal anecdotes, discover how tears of sorrow will cease but tears of joy may flow forever in the presence of God. A touching tribute to Robert S. Arnold, the composer of the beloved hymn, and an invitation to prepare for the joy of eternity.

item.title: Touching Without Touching
item.description: How often do we pass through life untouched by the true presence of God? In this heartfelt sermon, we explore the transformative power of the Master's touch, drawing parallels between Jesus' healing of the sick and the spiritual restoration He offers to each of us. Through biblical examples, including the woman who touched the hem of Jesus' garment (Mark 5:28) and the power of holy fellowship (Galatians 2:9), you'll discover the importance of true emotional, physical, and spiritual connection. Whether it's through the touch of His precepts, praises, or passions, this message challenges us to seek a deeper relationship with Christ. Don't just bump into Jesus—let Him truly touch your life.

item.title: Unification in a Divisive World
item.description: In a world that often feels divided, this heartfelt youth-led service reminds us of the power of unity through faith, worship, and family. Drawing inspiration from Ephesians 4:1-6, this lesson explores the importance of being one in Christ and how each of us contributes to the body of believers. Through prayer, singing, and scripture, we learn to overcome divisiveness and embrace our calling as Christ’s church. Be encouraged by this message of togetherness and hope for a brighter, united future.

item.title: What A Blind Man Saw That Others Did Not See
item.description: Have you ever wondered what you're blind to—both physically and spiritually? This thought-provoking sermon takes a deep dive into the concept of blindness, from Saul's transformative encounter on the road to Damascus to our own struggles with spiritual blind spots. Discover how disobedience, hypocrisy, and even spiritual immaturity can cloud our vision. Through vivid illustrations like "The Invisible Gorilla" experiment and Paul's newfound sight, this message challenges us to confront the areas in our lives where we resist seeing the truth. Are you ready to open your eyes to the light of the Gospel and the grace of God? Watch now and be inspired to truly see.

item.title: The Duties of a Believing Couple to the World
item.description: Marriage is more than just a partnership—it's a divine mission! In this insightful and heartfelt sermon, we explore God's design for believing couples to embody righteousness, responsibility, and relational love in a world often opposed to His truth. With humor, biblical insights, and practical wisdom, this message dives deep into Genesis 1, showing the duties of Christian couples: to be fruitful, relentless, influential, and more. Whether you're single, married, or searching for purpose, this lesson will inspire and challenge you to live boldly for Christ. Don't miss this powerful call to action—join us in discovering the greater purpose of God's design for relationships.

item.title: The Non Binary Conversion
item.description: Explore how God’s love extends to all, including those often overlooked, as seen through the story of the Ethiopian eunuch in Acts 8. This message delves into the historical and biblical significance of eunuchs, their role as "non-binary" figures in Scripture, and the radical inclusion displayed by Jesus and the early church. Learn how Philip’s mission to reach an outsider reveals the heart of the gospel—embracing the marginalized and sharing the transformative message of Christ. Prepare to be inspired to reach the “outsiders” in your own life with compassion and courage!

item.title: Risking Our Family
item.description: How are your relationships with your family? In this powerful message, we explore the seven attitudes that can threaten the bonds of family: irresponsibility, dishonesty, arrogance, lack of generosity, empathy, leniency, and compassion. With insights drawn from Matthew 18:23-35 and other biblical examples, you'll discover practical ways to protect and strengthen your family ties while embracing the grace and forgiveness found in Christ. Stay tuned for heartfelt stories, eye-opening statistics, and encouragement to live a life modeled after Jesus. Your family's foundation depends on it!

item.title: You Ask Me How I Know He Lives?
item.description: How do you know Jesus lives? This heartfelt sermon explores the personal, scriptural, and historical evidences of Christ's resurrection and presence in our lives. With moving illustrations, thought-provoking stories, and powerful reflections, it emphasizes the transformative power of faith, love, and hope. The message challenges us to go beyond mere belief, encouraging a revolutionary change of heart that only Christ can bring. Choose today to serve the risen Savior—because He lives, we can face tomorrow!

item.title: The Non Believer's Conversion
item.description: Explore a powerful message on the reality of counterfeit faith and its impact on the church, inspired by the story of Simon the Sorcerer in Acts 8. This sermon addresses the presence of false believers, fraudulent preachers, and insincere conversions while emphasizing our mission to reach all with the gospel. With historical insights and biblical truths, we are reminded to be vigilant yet compassionate as we navigate the challenges of genuine discipleship. A thought-provoking call to discernment, outreach, and safeguarding the faith.

item.title: Abraham’s Family Tests
item.description: How do we navigate the delicate balance between our love for family and our commitment to God? This thought-provoking sermon dives into the tests Abraham faced, as he chose faithfulness to God above familial ties. Through powerful examples from Genesis, we explore the spiritual challenges of prioritizing God over parents, siblings, spouses, and children. Be inspired by Abraham's faith, learn from his struggles, and reflect on what it means to put God "above all" in your life. An honest and heartfelt call to examine our priorities in light of Scripture.

item.title: A Non Bigoted Conversion
item.description: Explore the transformative message of Acts 8 as we delve into Philip's groundbreaking ministry among the Samaritans. This sermon challenges us to break free from biases, see ourselves as outsiders, and embrace the call to share the Gospel with all people. Through Philip's preaching, miraculous displays of God's power, and the resulting joy in Samaria, we learn powerful lessons about inclusivity, humility, and the unifying power of Christ's message. Join us as we reflect on what it means to reach out with a heart like Christ's and bring the joy of salvation to everyone.

item.title: Rewards of No Rewards
item.description: Explore the profound truth that the greatest rewards often come not from human recognition but from God Himself. Drawing from Hebrews 11:6 and Matthew 6:1-6, the message emphasizes the importance of diligently seeking God, performing acts of faith and kindness in secret, and trusting in God's timing for ultimate justice and reward. Through biblical examples like Mordecai, David, and Jesus, we uncover how God sees and honors faithfulness even when the world remains unaware. Be inspired to live as an unsung hero of faith, seeking the eternal rewards that only God can give.

item.title: Rewards of Facing a Lion
item.description: Explore the profound lessons behind the boldness of the righteous, the predestined confrontations with life's challenges, and the spiritual nourishment found in opposition. Using vivid biblical illustrations like Samson's encounter with a lion, Daniel in the lions' den, and the devil as a roaring lion (1 Peter 5:8), this message uncovers God's empowerment in our battles and the rewards that come from standing firm in faith. Discover how facing your lions leads to spiritual growth and courage to persevere. Perfect for anyone seeking strength in adversity and deeper insight into God’s plan.
